titleStmt.title: W. H. Goosey to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5546

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency
Govr. Thomas E Bramlette

The undersigned, would respectfully state that at the July Term 1860 of the Clark Circuit Court, he confessed two judgments against him upon two indictments in said Court for two small games of Cards, that he participated in for amusement in Clark County Ky, wherein 5 cents a game was won and lost That he did not so to wilfully violate the Statute to suppress gaming.

That since then he has abstained from further indulgence in said vice; and hopes to maintain his resolve not to do so again He says that he never was a Gambler in the meaning of that Term And I pray your Excellency to remit said fines, as I have quit all such practices,
We unite with Mr. Wm F. Goosey in his prayer to have his fines remitted. He is a good citizen, and we think that clemency to him in this instance will with good results.

Granville Clarke
A. N. Beesh
F. Low J. P. C. C
C J. Duncan
S. W. Breck
James Noland
Marquis. Debarra
Azariah Martin
Nelson C Tuttle
Jas Shepherd
James E Neil
Benj. C. Rice
Robert B Neil
Clark Rice

Clark Cir Ct
Wm F Goosey
Petn for Remission
Refused
Ansd
